image.altText: A building site with no workers in site.

props.synopsis: The construction industry warns the federal government's goal of building 1.2 million new well-located homes in the next five years will begin on the back foot because of a significant worker shortage.

title.children: 90,000 extra construction workers needed for goal of 1.2 million new homes, industry says

image.altText: Rebecca White in a pink suit stands on stage in front of the tally room, clutching notes.

props.synopsis: It is the third election loss for the party under Rebecca White's leadership, who says it is clear the Liberal Party will be asked by the governor to form a government.

title.children: Labor concedes Tasmanian election, leaving Liberals to negotiate with new crossbench

image.altText: Leather jacket featuring image of Celeste Manno and motorcyclist in background

props.synopsis: Demonstrators in Melbourne have called for murderers to get prison for life, saying slain woman Celeste Manno has been failed.

title.children: Supporters of slain Melbourne woman's family are calling for murderers to be given life sentences

image.altText: Carlos Sainz standing on the podium, being sprayed with wine, celebrating his victory.

props.synopsis: Ferrari's Carlos Sainz wins the Australian Grand Prix, after Max Verstappen retired after five laps with his rear brakes catching fire.

title.children: Carlos Sainz leads Ferrari 1-2 in triumphant Australian Grand Prix

image.altText: Composite of Lando Norris, Carlos Sainz, Charles Leclerc

props.synopsis: McLaren disappoints Australian fans in Melbourne, Carlos Sainz improves his resume for future job interviews, while Max Verstappen drove with a "handbrake".

title.children: Five quick hits â€” Oscar asked to move over for Norris, Carlos improves CV for future jobs, Verstappen drives with a 'handbrake'

image.altText: Tim Wilson talks to the media in front of a campaign sign for his challenger Zoe Daniel

props.synopsis: Liberal Party backs former federal MP who lost his seat to a teal independent to fight to win it back.

title.children: Liberal Party chooses Tim Wilson to contest his former Melbourne seat of Goldstein

image.altText: Thousands of people in shawls sit on the ground near a monument under blue sky

props.synopsis: Thousands of people in Ladakh demand action from the Indian government to protect the region's ecology and greater autonomy over how their land is used.

title.children: 'Climate fast' protest enters third week as thousands demand action in freezing temperatures in India

image.altText: A woman crouches down to the ground to light a candle surrounded by other candles, flowers and plush toys.

props.synopsis: Russia marks a day of mourning with people leaving flowers outside the concert hall where at least 133 people were killed in an attack on Friday.Â

title.children: Russia mourns victims of deadly concert hall attack

image.altText: Marilyn adjusts Audra's wedding veil

props.synopsis: Marilyn Rulyancich's baby was snatched from her during Australia's forced adoption era. But she never gave up hope of seeing her again â€” and now she's telling her remarkable story of subterfuge, detective work and sheer determination.

title.children: When Audra got married, she had no idea her mother she never met was standing right behind her

image.altText: A GWS AFL player is shown with legs extended after a big kick for goal.

props.synopsis: GWS wraps up round two with a solid win over West Coast in Perth, with Essendon's Peter Wright set to face the tribunal on Tuesday night for the hit that left Sydney's Harry Cunningham concussed.

title.children: Giants' big win over Eagles wraps up round two, as Bombers' Wright sent straight to tribunal

image.altText: A group of basketball players celebrate a last-second shot

props.synopsis: Jack McVeigh hits one of the greatest shots in NBL history to down Melbourne United and put the JackJumpers one win away from their first ever championship victory.Â

title.children: 'The shot of his life': JackJumpers win NBL Finals game three with 'simply incredible' half-court game winner

image.altText: A slightly smiling middle-aged woman leans against a wooden post, in front of a beach. Dark curly hair, glasses, blue top.

props.synopsis: A growing proportion of older couples in relationships that span over decades are splitting up, with about one in four divorces taking place after the age of 50. But experts warn it could have significant implications for the wider society.

title.children: Leanne separated from her spouse of 20 years when she was 53. She's not alone

image.altText: aerial shot of melbourne showing houses and city skyscrapers

props.synopsis: Melbourne has seen improvements in its affordability metrics over the past five years, but data shows there are no suburbs the average Victorian on a single wage could afford to buy a house without mortgage stress.

title.children: Can you afford a house in Melbourne? Probably not â€” here's why

image.altText: The rooftops of houses.

props.synopsis: Prosper Australia says if we were smarter about taxing land, we could slash taxes on workers and businesses, writes Gareth Hutchens.Â

title.children: If we taxed land properly, we'd have billions of extra dollars to fund big tax cuts elsewhere. So why don't we do it?

image.altText: Bill Shorten standing in front of a NDIS logo

props.synopsis: NDIS participants exploited by unfair price hikes can now report price gouging to a new taskforce.

title.children: Government launches NDIS taskforce to crack down on providers overcharging participants

image.altText: The outside of a Medibank branch.

props.synopsis: As private health premiums are set to rise, some Australians are making a conscious decision to opt for "self-insurance" rather than "health insurance" to cut down on expenses. Experts warn it's not for everyone.

title.children: With health insurance premiums about to increase, these people decided to 'self-fund' their private healthcare instead

image.altText: A police man standing in high-vis next to a police wagon, parked across a road

props.synopsis: Northern Territory Police took a 32-year-old man, who they believe to be the driver of the vehicle, into custody and seized a Ford Ranger on Sunday afternoon.

title.children: Alleged fatal hit-and-run in Alice Springs being treated as possible death in custody

image.altText: Students and man in orange and blue space suits collect rocks in rocky terrain simulated crater beside rover

props.synopsis: An Australian-built lunar rover has been designed to help extract resources like oxygen and metals to enable astronauts to breathe in space and create rocket fuel during NASA's next mission to the moon.

title.children: Moon mining rover set to utilise 'infinite resources and energy of space', extracting oxygen and metals from lunar soil

image.altText: A composite image ofÂ Jeremy Rockliff and Rebecca White on election night.

props.synopsis: Despite calling an early election to regain majority government, the Tasmanian Liberals have fallen short. But so too has Labor. Here's what will happen next.Â

title.children: Confused about the Tasmanian election result? You are not alone

image.altText: A lady with blonde hair in a blue shirt standing next to a large pile of white goods at a dump and a sign saying white goods

props.synopsis: Electrical appliances are piling up at Thargomindah's rubbish tip after damage caused by an unstable power supply, and there isn't much locals can do about it.

title.children: White goods graveyard in outback town caused by storms hundreds of kilometres away

image.altText: A kid throws his head back in laughter, he is wearing a dark green hoodie with a brown fur trim.

props.synopsis: Laughter is one of the healthiest things a child can do, but it means very different things at different stages of brain development.

title.children: Why do children laugh? It's not always because they're happy

image.altText: A woman wearing a hat rests her arm on top of a rusted refrigerator while a small dog waits next to her.

props.synopsis: He didn't know it at the time, but Wes Herring wasn't standing alone on the precipice of breaking point â€” we explore how he and others are overcoming the mental torments of life on the land.

title.children: How the rigours of rural life are taking a heavy toll in the bush

image.altText: A composite of headshots of both men speaking at microphones.

props.synopsis: Defence Minister Richard Marles says United States ambassador Kevin Rudd has been working with both sides of politics to progress AUKUS, and his confidence is not shaken by former president Donald Trump's remarks that Dr Rudd is "nasty".

title.children: Defence minister 'confident' AUKUS will be safe under Trump, despite Rudd remarks

image.altText: A man stands in a carpark speaking to the media with the glow of a burning building behind him

props.synopsis: Four people have recounted the night terrorists stormed a Moscow concert hall and unleashed unspeakable terror that left more than 143 people dead.

title.children: 'Simply a nightmare': Eyewitnesses recount horror of Moscow terror attack

image.altText: Julia Baird, who has short brown-blonde hair and is wearing a black wetsuit, looks over the ocean in morning sunlight

props.synopsis: One of the greatest myths is that by just being positive, or cheerful, we can somehow erase our problems.What I'm more interested in is the simpler question of: how do we go on?Â

title.children: 'Seven times down, eight times up': When life is hard, how do we go on?

image.altText: woman in a cream sweater lies on a couch with white headphones on

props.synopsis: Climate activist Greta Thunberg describes herself as having Asperger's while others on the autism spectrum, such as comedian Hannah Gatsby, describe themselves as "autistic". But what's the difference?

title.children: Whatâ€™s the difference between autism and Aspergerâ€™s disorder?

image.altText: A pink building.

props.synopsis: India has denied killing Hardeep Singh Nijjar, but an ABC investigation has found evidence government agencies were searching his family home in Punjab in the weeks before his death.

title.children: What happened at this pink building in remote India could hold new clues in a killing that rocked the world

image.altText: A man smiles as a woman takes a photo of him on her phone on board a boat on a lake

props.synopsis: For a man whose job is upholding the integrity of WA's public service, Chris Field spends a lot of time overseas â€” a matter that has landed him before a corruption inquiry. Andrea Mayes explains how travelling to meet international dignitaries entered his job description.

title.children: From limos in Rome to Taiwan hot springs. Here's why the corruption watchdog is investigating WA's ombudsman

image.altText: Valentino Guseli holds the World Cup crystal globe in Silvaplana, Switzerland.

props.synopsis: Australian teen snowboarder Valentino Guseli underlines his phenomenal talent with another World Cup crystal globe as the season's overall park and pipe champion.

title.children: Aussie snowboard ace Guseli wins back-to-back World Cup crystal globes

image.altText: A woman in a tiara and blue cape in a carriage

props.synopsis: The palace has a difficult job ahead managing the public's insatiable desire for information, respecting Catherine's treatment and privacy, and calming speculation in the digital age, writes Isabella Higgins.Â

title.children: Kate has asked for a reprieve. Her request will test the palace, the tabloids and her future subjects

image.altText: An older boy in shorts, his mum, a younger boy, his dad and a girl in a uniform walk hand in hand

props.synopsis: The Princess of Wales' cancer revelation helps explain a turbulent few months within the House of Windsor. This is how a chaotic start to 2024 unfolded for the royals.Â

title.children: From an absence at a family event to a call to the BBC. This is how Kate's diagnosis unfolded

image.altText: Graphic image with Donald Trump appearing above images of Tim Scott, Kristi Noem and Marjorie Taylor Greene.

props.synopsis: A gun-loving grandma, a former Democrat and a MAGA frontwoman â€” who will Donald Trump pick from his long shortlist of running mates? And will his pick be based on strategy or aesthetics?

title.children: 'Out of central casting': Could Donald Trump choose this woman as running mate?

image.altText: Workers in uniform stand inside a hall that has been destroyed by fire.

props.synopsis: Russia has not made public any evidence of a Ukrainian connection, and ISIS-K, a branch of the Islamic State group, has claimed responsibility for the attack.

title.children: Putin hints at Ukrainian involvement in Moscow concert hall attack as Russia arrests alleged gunmen
